phrases: yume kanaeru made chousen wa tsuzuku
juunengo no mirai kagayaiteru sugata wa
koukai wa shinai jibun de egaita story
makenai to i am about to mune ni chikatta
yume no tochuu de meguriau deai to wakare
kimi ga oshietekureta boku dake ga motsu chikara
Baby I trust you my friend
Mashiro, let us do our best.
I know you can draw without resting.
Let us make our dreams come true.
I-I cannot tell him to stop drawing.
The editorial department is going ahead with their plans to put you on hiatus with chapter 20 in issue 33.
I will not go on hiatus.
That is what I will tell them when I get back to the office.
And I will also tell them I think you can draw in the hospital.
Oh, it is already this late?
Saiko, do not push yourself too hard.
Yeah, I cannot go to school, so I should be able to get some decent sleep.
Anyways, I think I can make a clean copy of the rest of chapter 20's storyboard by tomorrow.
No, you do not need to.
I can understand the story well enough from Takagi's version.
I will work it out with Takagi and make sure you can get started on the manuscript by Saturday, as usual.
But there is still a bit of time left, is not there?
He did something he did not need to.
I will come every day I can.
Because I am worried... and I cannot email you here.
Well, I can use my cell phone if I step outside the hospital...
I should be able to turn it on if I go out into the courtyard.
You do not need to worry so much.
It may contradict what I said before,
but being able to see you makes me happy.
Let us limit it to until you are released from the hospital.
I might also be contradicting myself.
When I am with you, I get embarrassed and my heart starts pounding...
but it also calms me down.
I feel like I want us to be together forever.
But only until I am discharged.
I am glad I got sick.
It seems like I will have some good memories of being here with you.
Does it bother you that we decided to stay apart until our dreams come true?
I think it is hard sometimes,
and after I get discharged it will be hard to go back to being apart from you,
but that is exactly why I can push myself.
I want to see you soon.
I want to be with you.
I am saying I think he can still draw!
I do not want to force them to go on hiatus!
Well, we can at least put the bit that the assistants finish up into issue 32.
However, I will still put out the hiatus announcement from issue 33 onwards.
Are you telling me you received permission to let him draw from his doctor?
I will accompany you to the hospital tomorrow.
It seems I cannot count on you to get the job done.
The patient is saying that if he is not allowed to draw, his stress will increase, and it will be bad for his health.
It is true that patients should be allowed to do as they like in moderation.
Ah, sorry to barge in, madam.
Thank you for taking care of my son.
It is not something I should mention here.
We are to blame for the current situation, and I offer my deepest apologies.
Stop drawing manga in your hospital room!
Ah, well, the doctor said it was fine in moderation...
He will not be able to do it in moderation!
Well, it is not good to be too persistent.
I would like to talk with you.
My husband said that he is not a child anymore, and to let him continue on the path he chose.
Rest assured, we will not let any harm come to him.
I think I should go visit Ashirogi in the hospital.
Where did you hear about that?
We tried to keep it quiet.
I will not reveal my source.
You would dry it up, of course.
Even Niizuma will not pick up my calls anymore.
Anyways, I have barged into Ashirogi's before, and they took care of me.
It is only proper that I go visit them.
A manga author is not a real member of society.
I am not a member of society anymore?
I am already a caged bird.
No, I am Mr. Yoshida's pet dog.
I am not allowed to act like a human anymore!
If I was not here, you would look up his hospital and go anyways, right?
Let us just go on Monday and get it over with, then.
In exchange, I will be going with you, and we are coming back right away.
I heard Mashiro is in the hospital.
I also heard that they are on hiatus starting from issue 33.
Going on hiatus after finally getting popular...
It seems Niizuma already went to see him.
I am going on Monday, want to come?
I am pushing it every week.
I do not have that kind of time!
Come on, do not be so cold.
If I invite Miss Aoki, she will be sure to come.
I am really pushing my deadline.
Would you stop tempting me like that?
I am worried about Mashiro, but I just cannot...
I will just tell him you are concerned for him, too.
Yeah, and she even propped up Saiko with her own hands.
I thought they were not even going to hold hands until they got married.
You would think she would stop him.
No, this showed me once again how much she really does like him.
The ultimate love is accepting everything your partner wishes for, and helping to achieve it.
And perhaps cooperating with them as well.
But I would be too worried about his health and stop him.
Well, it does take some strength to stay apart until their dreams come true.
Can they go back to staying apart now?
If they kiss in the hospital or something, I bet they will not be able to!
Where are you going with that?
Whatever, you do not understand a woman's heart.
I will give it to Saiko even if there is fixes to be made.
H-He is still drawing even though he is been hospitalized!
It is kind of tough to work in here, and it is a bit cramped, but I cannot allow a break in our serialization.
Is not he the model manga author?
Are you drawn to this kind of lifestyle, Miss Girlfriend?
Mr. Yoshida, when we return, I will definitely draw.
I feel like I was mistaken...
You should feel ashamed of yourself, Hiramaru.
Oh, if it is not the escape artist Hiramaru.
He is the author of KIYOSHI Knights, Fukuda.
You met him earlier at Niizuma's house, right?
Thanks for taking care of me then, Fukuda.
Please give me your contact information and the address of your office, if you would...
You are not even really reading Jack, are you?
Seriously though, seeing you work while hospitalized has given me a better opinion of you, Mashiro.
I will not lose to you all.
We were just talking about him being a model manga author.
I laughed at the Wanted: Hiramaru fax from Yoshida.
Well, I am glad that you are lively enough to draw the manuscript.
It is pretty loud in here for a hospital room.
I apologize, but I must ask everyone but Mashiro and Takagi to leave the room.
Why do we have to leave?
Because this has nothing to do with you.
Of course, it is written as comrade but read as rival.
No matter what I say, do not make a fuss.
Is it something we would make a fuss over?
Last night, we had a meeting regarding what to do with Detective TRAP.
Detective TRAP will be put on hiatus until next April, when the authors graduate from high school.
I told you not to make a fuss.
Why April instead of when he is discharged?!
Miura, you told us it was fine to start this storyboard on Saturday!
It is because Kawaguchi Tarou died.
The death of my uncle and our serialization have nothing in common.
There was someone I knew who worked too hard on manga and died.
The person he told me about, that was his...?
Kawaguchi Tarou was Mashiro's uncle on his father's side.
His death is firmly linked to his occupation as a manga author.
It would not be a stretch to say that he was a victim of manga.
Your mother is worried and wants you to stop drawing manga entirely.
No one wants to lose their family, the ones they love.
Tarou never broke a serialization deadline even once.
Even when he had a fever above 104...
Even when he strained his back and could not sit up,
he drew his manuscript while lying down.
He never went on hiatus even once.
He said he was proud of that, at least.
That is an old-fashioned way of thinking, but it is respectable that you do not want a hiatus.
But when the editorial department decides you need rest, then you must rest.
Continuing to draw would trouble all of us.
Even after he gets better, he is still on hiatus until April.
Are not you contradicting yourself by telling him to get better, then not picking the serialization back up?
The genius high schooler Niizuma Eiji.
We were impressed with his performance in serialization, so the editorial board approved serializing authors in high school.
But a weekly serialization is not that easy.
We regret it, and will refrain from approving such serializations in the future.
But serializations that have already started should be another matter!
You are irresponsible for starting this policy now!
There should not be a problem then!
Even if you do that, I will not lift the hiatus until April!
What Ashirogi's saying makes more sense!
Put yourself in their parents' positions!
Dropping out of high school to draw manga.
Will your parents be happy with that?
I do not live for my parents!
A special Sunday meeting was held yesterday, and that is what was decided upon.
I was interested as well, so I asked the vice-editor, but all he said was It will be a problem if he dies on us.
Aida, do you know who Kawaguchi Tarou was?
He was the one-hit-wonder who made Super Hero Legend.
He did not want to end his career with just that, so he continued writing storyboards and eventually died from overwork.
That is just a rumor, right?
No, apparently, it is the truth.
His real name was Mashiro Nobuhiro.
He was none other than Mashiro's uncle.
I guess they had no choice, then.
He is not allowed to draw until April because he is Kawaguchi Tarou's relative?
We are ignoring Mashiro's... no, Ashirogi Muto's feelings!
If Kawaguchi Tarou was not my uncle...
you would not be doing this.
What is with that lame excuse?
Where else would I go but back to my room to draw manga?
Miura, this is your fault, too, you yes-man.
On the contrary, he resisted until the very end.
I will not accept this hiatus until April bull.
Even if you draw, I will not publish it until April.
But if you regain your health and graduate high school, I promise to restart the serialization then.
What is with this April thing?!
Takagi, Mashiro, I am so sorry!
It is as you saw I have no authority.
I am the one who needs to apologize.
To you, Shujin... and Azuki too.
If I had not gotten sick...
It is the chief editor's decision!
Yes, and it is also due to my powerlessness.
You do not need to apologize to me.
The words I said to you the day we graduated middle school... will hold true forever.
Take your time to get better.
What is this about graduation day?
Well, even if I ask, you probably will not tell me.
I said I would always be waiting.
So she is worried about his health.
I will always be waiting, huh.
I will not forgive the chief editor for putting Ashirogi in that situation.
I will not draw for Jack until he withdraws his decision.
But if I am the only one doing that, it will not make a big impact.
If they are making TRAP take a break, then I will take a break too!
But will not Ashirogi feel guilty about that?
That is why we are going to keep this quiet from them,
and only tell them after the editor withdraws his decision.
I will convince Nakai and Aoki.
The entire Fukuda Team will boycott!
It is wonderful, it is fun, and tomorrow just got a bit brighter.
We are talking about a person's life here!
Like I said, please tell us about yesterday's meeting in more detail!
I just cannot go along with it this time!
Right, I feel bad for Ashirogi!
We will not draw Kiyoshi, CROW, or Otters 11 until he withdraws his decision.
And if he does not give in, I will draw for another magazine until Ashirogi can draw again.
But you have a contract, so you cannot do that...
I will return the down payment and do it!
If it comes down to it, I will pay the termination fees for Ashirogi and everyone else so we can migrate to another magazine!
I want to keep drawing manga, you know.
Nakai, you are not manly enough at times like these.
I feel that the Chief Editor is going too far.
Oh, Miss Aoki, this is the first time we have agreed on something.
For a boycott, the more people we have, the better.
What are you trying to pull in this confusion?
You see, I am weak against beautiful women.
I am worried about them, too.
It is too quiet in here.
We cannot just keep quiet about this.
Hey, the Chief Editor is just outside.
And even if you protest, there is no way he would change his mind once it is made up.
What do you mean by that?
If arrangements are not made for TRAP's early return, we will also go on hiatus.
They each took the phone and announced it.
That is five series counting TRAP.
It will be a huge problem if they all go on hiatus!
Since they have gone out of their way to tell us about the boycott, I am going to let the Chief Editor know.
It is the editors' job to make the authors draw!
We cannot just accept it quietly!
Yuujirou, everyone was on the same phone, right?
Which means they are all in the same place right now.
Try asking them where they are.
I am in charge of Fukuda and Niizuma.
This is a problem regarding TRAP, so I will come too.
Listen, when we leave the department, let us go in ones and twos so we do not raise suspicion.
There are five of us here.
All of our editors, plus Hattori, are coming in secret without the Chief Editor knowing.
It is a battle between authors and editors!
We are boycotting until the decision about Ashirogi's hiatus is reversed!
It seems like an unprecedented situation will occur.
It is unprecedented that you and I agree on something!
I will not forgive a guy who crushes dreams!

kimi ga oshietekureta boku dake ga motsu chikara
The fight does not end until I fulfill my dream
I wonder how far I have come now?
In ten years, I will be living the dream
It is the scenario I wrote for myself, so I will have no regrets
But life is not that easy, and it is full of obstacles
Still, I swear to myself that I will not ever back down
I have a dream that I absolutely want to achieve
So I fuel my passion until I succeed
There will be meetings and partings along the way
But I will simply believe in my strength that you have taught me
And rise back up again and again and again
zetsubou ni fushita kokoro no sumi
tooriame no ato ni mitsuketa niji wo motte
In this world, every day is dull and full of nonsense
I cover my ears, trying to mute the noise
Why do people hurt each other?
on the recesses of my heart, fallen into despair
While carrying this pain in my chest,
can I really dream of tomorrow?
can I really dream of tomorrow?
Remembering the rainbow I found after the rain,
